title: Quiz 2: Personality Development & Etiology
topicName: Unit 1: Mental Health and Psychiatric Nursing
description: Deep dive into Erikson's developmental stages, Freud's theory, and the causes of mental illness.

questions.question: Match the Erikson developmental stage to its corresponding age range:
questions.hint: Think about the life tasks: feeding, playing, teenage years, working/parenting.

questions.question: A child is 8 years old, enjoys school, and is acquiring skills in sports and language. According to Erikson, which stage are they in?
questions.explanation: Industry vs. Inferiority occurs during school years (6-12 years) where children acquire skills.
questions.hint: School age is about being industrious.

questions.question: The ___BLANK___ is the primitive part of personality driven by impulses, while the ___BLANK___ contains values and moral regulations.
questions.explanation: Freud defined the Id as primitive/impulsive and the Super Ego as the moral compass.

questions.question: Which of the following are classified as 'Precipitating Factors' of mental illness? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Precipitating factors are triggers shortly before onset (physical or social/psychological). Early experiences are Predisposing; secondary issues are Perpetuating.

questions.question: What is the term for factors that prolong the course of a mental illness after it has been triggered?
questions.explanation: Perpetuating factors (like withdrawal or demoralisation) maintain the illness.
questions.hint: To 'perpetuate' means to make something continue.

questions.question: According to Erikson, failure to successfully complete one developmental stage does not affect the subsequent stages.
questions.explanation: The text states that difficulty in one stage leads to difficulties in subsequent stages.

questions.question: Which classification system of mental disorders is published by the World Health Organization (WHO)?
questions.explanation: The International Classification of Diseases (ICD) is the WHO system.

questions.question: Match the ICD 10 code group to the disorder type:
Which factor influencing attitudes towards mental illness involves the belief in germ theory versus evil spirits?

richContent.content: 'It will depend on how the patient explains the illness to themselves...'

questions.explanation: Health Beliefs determine how a patient explains the illness (germs vs. spirits).
questions.hint: What does the person 'believe' causes the sickness?

questions.question: What is the primary function of the 'Ego' in Freud's personality structure?
questions.explanation: The Ego mediates between the Id and Super Ego and is in contact with reality.
